Usage

Installation

To use CountergenTorch, first install it using pip:

(.venv) $ pip install countergen

Outline of the evaluation process

Data Augmentation

First, you produce a list of AugmentedSample, either by loading an existing one, or using tools the library provides to build you it from raw data, or by creating your own from scratch.

class countergen.types.AugmentedSample

Hold different variations of a sample with the same meaning, which should have the same expected outputs.

abstract get_variations()

The variations of the original input, which still should procude one of the expected outputs.

Return type

Sequence[Variation]

abstract property input: str

The original input.

abstract property outputs: List[str]

The expected outputs.

Where a Variation is defined as follows.

class countergen.types.Variation(text, categories)

An input associated with the different categories it belongs to.

Parameters

  • text (str) –

  • categories (Tuple[str, ...]) –

Model Loading

Second, you load your model and turn it into a ModelEvaluator, which is just a callable that returns the performance of a model given an input and expected outputs.

Model Evaluation

Third, you pass your list of AugmentedSample and your ModelEvaluator into the following function:

countergen.evaluate(samples, model, aggregator=PerformanceStatsPerCategory())

Return the aggregate of the performance of each variation in each sample.

Parameters

  • samples (Iterable[AugmentedSample]) –

  • model (Callable[[str, List[str]], float]) –

  • aggregator (Aggregator[T]) –

Return type

T

By default, it will return the average performance on each kind of data. You can specify other ways to aggregate the performance on each variation by passing another Aggregator.

Alternatively, if you just want to print or save the results, directly evaluate_and_print() or evaluate_and_save()

And that’s it! countergen and countergentorch provide powerful ways to generate variations, load models easily, and edit them to decrease performance gaps between different categories. Click on Next to know more.
